column1: 953C358B-CAF9-422D-91EA-8E131E55115D#appfire#59A116E1-5B65-45CC-88DD-2CC6C10A3967#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#A5E0D5A4-4CB1-48AF-AC18-65BB2EBDEE98#appfire#59A116E1-5B65-45CC-88DD-2CC6C10A3967#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#CE3F943B-EF3F-442D-B0B7-BCE58CE1F432#appfire#59A116E1-5B65-45CC-88DD-2CC6C10A3967#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-30 13:09:29.0#appfire#1
